snippet: An anti-corruption group was heartened when China’s new president, Xi Jinping, came to power in 2012. Since then, their ideals have collided with a harsh reality.
abstract: About 20 Chinese activists associated with the New Citizens Movement are detained after calling for a fight against injustice and official corruption; crushing of group, who is facing trial and jail, is just one stark example of refusal by China's new leader Xi Jinping to countenance any stirrings of opposition.

byline.original: By ANDREW JACOBS and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Andrew Jacobs reported from Beijing, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong.
